column1: Roughly half of Americans want the US to remain as the sole military superpower.
column2: About 1/3 of Americans think it would be okay if China or another country became as powerful as the US.
column3: Two thirds of Republicans want the US to remain as the sole military superpower.
column4: Half of Democrats want the US to remain as the sole military superpower.
column5: A bit more than half of independents want the US to remain as the sole military superpower.
column6: Only a quarter of Republicans think it would be okay if China or another country became as powerful as the US.
column7: About 40% of Democrats think it would be okay if China or another country became as powerful as the US.
column8: About 1/3 of Independents think it would be okay if China or another country became as powerful as the US.
column9: Republicans are the most strong believers that the US should remain as the only military superpower.
column10: Democrats are the most strong believers that it would be okay if another country became as powerful as the US.
column11: Independents' percentages on this issue closely reflect the percentages of the total population.
